description.narrative:
Insatsen avser ett programstöd genom poolfinansiering till UNDP Armenien om totalt 18 200 000 SEK för att implementera programmet "Modern Parliament for a Modern Armenia” under perioden 2019-2022.
Insatsen syftar till att stärka kapaciteten hos det nybildade armeniska parlamentet i dess nyckelfunktioner; lagstiftning, granskning och representation. Detta med fokus på ökad kvalitet, transparens, innovation samt att främja inkluderande ansatser och arbetssätt så att de grupper som generellt exkluderats i parlamentarisk verksamhet i ökad utsträckning inkluderas. Insatsen syftar även till att stärka kompetens och kapacitet för att främja och säkerställa jämställdhet och respekt för mänskliga rättigheter i parlamentets och kommittéernas policy-utveckling, i lagstiftning och i den i övriga parlamentariska verksamheten.
Den totala budgeten för projektet uppgår till 5 000 000 USD (cirka 48 465 500 SEK) för perioden 2019-2022, av vilken Sida kommer att bidra med 18 200 000 SEK i stöd genom en samlingsfond (basket fund). Den återstående delen planeras att täckas med medel från andra institutionella givare så som Storbritannien och Tyskland. Sveriges utrikesdepartement har redan bidragit med 205 200 USD till den katalytiska fasen av projektet som utgör projektets sex första månader. Den armeniska regeringen har parallellt budgeterat för renoveringar av nationalförsamlingens lokaler vilket också kommer att bidra till projektet.

The proposed intervention is a request from UNDP to contribute to the project “Modern Parliament for a Modern Armenia” during the period 2019-2022 with a total amount of 18 200 000 SEK.
The purpose of the project is to strengthen the newly established National Assembly in its fundamentally enhanced role within the governance system. The project aims to enhance capacities of the Armenian legislature in carrying out its key functions of law-making, oversight and representation, focusing on improved quality, transparency, inclusiveness of parliamentary operations as well as enhanced parliamentary capacity for gender-responsive policy making. The project additionally aims at cultivating innovation, design and technology as drivers of parliamentary strengthening.
The project will be implemented through a basket fund model. The total amount of the project is estimated to USD 5 000 000 (approximately 48 138 000 SEK) for the period 2019-2022. Sida intend to commit to the basket fund with SEK 18 200 000 which is what has been requested by UNDP. The Swedish MFA has already committed with USD 209 754 for the catalytic stage of the project. The UK have committed with USD 2 021 634. The Armenian government have in parallel budgeted for constructions in 2020 of the NA premises which will gain the project.

The purpose of the project is to strengthen the newly established National Assembly in its fundamentally enhanced role within the governance system. The project aims to enhance capacities of the Armenian legislature in carrying out its key functions of law-making, oversight and representation, focusing on improved quality, transparency, inclusiveness of parliamentary operations as well as enhanced parliamentary capacity for gender-responsive policy making. The project additionally aims at cultivating innovation, design and technology as drivers of parliamentary strengthening. The project is expected to result in the following overarching outcomes: 1) Quality of legislative oversight and policy making is improved 2) Transparency and accountability of legislative processes is increased 3) Legislative responsiveness, inclusivity and participatory apporach is embedded in MP's work

description.narrative: The project started in January and has therefore not jet been reported on. Below are some highlights from the implemeation so far: Code of Ethics - The Project engaged consultancy for Human Rights mapping and the Transparency International Armenia for anti-corruption contribution to the Code. The CoE and OSCE are part of the team assisting the National Assembly in setting the ethics standards. Both reports were finalized and have been shared with the Parliament and to the Speaker. A presentation for audience outside the Parliament is to take place in September with COE and OSCE for MPs. As part of this joint support, the Project worked with the Council of Europe (CoE), provided consultancy on EC standards concerning corruption aspects of parliamentary ethics, and the OSCE/ ODIHR on standards of parliamentary ethics. Upon the National Assembly’s request, the Project provided technical assistance in mapping the relevant legislation of Armenia towards the Code of Ethics. The mapping set out the ethics system and development of legislative and regulatory processes to provide the application of requirements for MPs and divided into two subject areas: a) anti-corruption aspects of integrity and accountability; and b) respect for human rights and ethical behavior. Follow up meetings and consultations with all political factions in the Parliament are planned before adoption, in this process the Project will provide support and help develop capacities in organizing issue-based discussions and consultation. Socio-Economic Recovery for Armenia (post COVID-19 Government Strategies with support of UN Agencies)– MAP project platform is set to facilitate the NA role in policy making. A consultative zoom meeting held with Chairs of Committees to present the assessment findings and the proposed plan took place in July 2020. Follow up meetings with respective committees to be scheduled from September. Inter-parliamentary Union (IPU) – has decided to include the National Assembly of Armenia’s cooperation with CSOs and citizens to be part for the 3rd Global Parliamentary Report. The NA was selected as one of the few parliaments globally and pilot a Questionnaire for that purpose. IT Assessment: The project finalized the first Assessment of the IT infrastructure Capacities of the National Assembly. The assessment includes the status of the data centre, server equipment, network, and IT staff capacity analysis. Concrete recommendations for enhancing the National Assembly’s IT infrastructure toward the implementation of new digital tools and systems are also provided. Example of small scheme technical support to the National Assembly’s Standing Committees (SCs): - Standing Committee on Health Care and Social Affairs for Technical support to survey parliamentary oversight of the implementation of articles on social and health issues on the Law on Local Self-Government (HO-237-N). The TOR is finalized with the SC and processed for the bidding. - Standing Committee on Defence and Security requested technical support in terms of comparative analysis of best practices in the field of constitutional security. The request is being crosschecked with other international partners to escape the overlap of activities. - Standing Committee on Protection of Human Rights and Public Affairs submitted 3 requests for the technical support
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
